channel.title: New serverstatus backend
channel.description:
It should be almost impossible to cheat the serverstatus page by posting any server with an open port now that I verify that the given server is actually a runescape private server (thanks to c|p which provided that particular code). I also delay when a newly posted server is displayed so that people can't keep trying new ways to get around the detection. Therefore now all of the online servers should actually be online, and able to be logged into by moparscape.
Any other suggestions? Also does anyone feel like writing a new layout (frontend)?

item.title: New serverstatus backend
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

newbiehacker:

I wrote a serverstatus list once that logged into each server in order to verify it (may be overkill, but PHP can be fun too!)

Do you still have the code? (I check servers with Java now, it seems much easier…)

Read full topic

item.title: New serverstatus backend
item.dc:creator: @newbiehacker newbiehacker
item.description:
@newbiehacker wrote:

I wrote a serverstatus list once that logged into each server in order to verify it (may be overkill, but PHP can be fun too!)

Also, if there are any sections for server development that I can’t currently see, I’d love to have a meander, if that’d be cool <3

Read full topic

item.title: New serverstatus backend
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

Taharok:

Or only ‘advanced coders’ should be able to post and everyone else can view (for teasing purposes).

I’ve seen about 3 threads today which contained ‘my 503 is complete come DL and all of them were virus’s’

Hense why they should not be allowed to post, good point Taharok.

Read full topic

item.title: New serverstatus backend
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:16, topic:225730”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=296642.msg2388050#msg2388050 date=1218853786]

[quote author=TeleNubby link=topic=296642.msg2387906#msg2387906 date=1218848332]

Speaking of the 503, does anyone have a working deob that doesn’t freeze on runtime? If someone does then please upload it. Hybridscape was going to be for the 503, but we encounted a runtime problem. When Silabsoft and Zerofreeze are back, work will continue on it.

As for my 317, I’m implementing various packethandlers as I speak.
[/quote]http://telenubby.info/dl/TeleNubby_503_Client.7z

It has a fully refactored Stream class for you, if you’re interested.

Is that the one Speljohan posted on the MITB portion of the website? It froze on runtime when we tried using it. =\ I’ll give it another try though.
[/quote]The one he posted was not completely finished for the ability to run it straight off the bat after downloading it. You had to modify it a little more. Not to mention, try sticking a copy of the cache in cache/ instead of where Jagex hides it when using that deob. This one works fine, or at least should. I’ve refactored a little more, changed a few things, and refactored the entire Stream class until I got bored. Enjoy it.[/quote]

We* did the stream class

Moparisthebest:

It already sorts by uptime, and then resorts by date registered so that for each % the oldest is at the top? Would any other way be useful?

Not really I guess. The sorting by uptime is really all that’s needed.

Read full topic

item.title: New serverstatus backend
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:16, topic:225730”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=296642.msg2388050#msg2388050 date=1218853786]

[quote author=TeleNubby link=topic=296642.msg2387906#msg2387906 date=1218848332]

Speaking of the 503, does anyone have a working deob that doesn’t freeze on runtime? If someone does then please upload it. Hybridscape was going to be for the 503, but we encounted a runtime problem. When Silabsoft and Zerofreeze are back, work will continue on it.

As for my 317, I’m implementing various packethandlers as I speak.
[/quote]http://telenubby.info/dl/TeleNubby_503_Client.7z

It has a fully refactored Stream class for you, if you’re interested.

Is that the one Speljohan posted on the MITB portion of the website? It froze on runtime when we tried using it. =\ I’ll give it another try though.
[/quote]The one he posted was not completely finished for the ability to run it straight off the bat after downloading it. You had to modify it a little more. Not to mention, try sticking a copy of the cache in cache/ instead of where Jagex hides it when using that deob. This one works fine, or at least should. I’ve refactored a little more, changed a few things, and refactored the entire Stream class until I got bored. Enjoy it.[/quote]
Cheers. Haven’t tested it yet - I’ve been reversing client -> server 317 packets, so that I can upload a copy later with what I have so far. With that done, other Vets should be able to help with implementation to speed it up a bit.

Read full topic

Speaking of the 503, does anyone have a working deob that doesn’t freeze on runtime? If someone does then please upload it. Hybridscape was going to be for the 503, but we encounted a runtime problem. When Silabsoft and Zerofreeze are back, work will continue on it.

As for my 317, I’m implementing various packethandlers as I speak.
[/quote]http://telenubby.info/dl/TeleNubby_503_Client.7z

It has a fully refactored Stream class for you, if you’re interested.

Is that the one Speljohan posted on the MITB portion of the website? It froze on runtime when we tried using it. =\ I’ll give it another try though.[/quote]The one he posted was not completely finished for the ability to run it straight off the bat after downloading it. You had to modify it a little more. Not to mention, try sticking a copy of the cache in cache/ instead of where Jagex hides it when using that deob. This one works fine, or at least should. I’ve refactored a little more, changed a few things, and refactored the entire Stream class until I got bored. Enjoy it.

item.title: New serverstatus backend
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

As far as 503 servers go, when it comes to that I will write a method for checking if they are online and post a different serverstatus page elsewhere with them on it, sound reasonable?

That sounds like a good idea.

Tico135:

Please, let’s not worry about 503 sections until someone has come out with a stable 503, one that isn’t winterlove all over again.

Yea I was suggesting a server status page for 503 servers, not really a development section. For example I have a stable 503 I’ve made from scratch, but I’m not releasing it. The people here probably couldn’t use it anyway, since it involves MySQL. Anything with MySQL people post tutorials on how to make it use text and CFG files.

Read full topic

item.title: New serverstatus backend
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

ry60003333:

Maybe only allowing letters, numbers, and spaces in the server name. I’m sorry but things like this just make me mad.

I like it, I’ll do it when I can.

Taharok:

How about adding in a search engine as to search for servers using their ip address, port or name.

Good idea, I’ll look into it.

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:5, topic:225730”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=296642.msg2385798#msg2385798 date=1218755203]
How about adding in a search engine as to search for servers using their ip address, port or name.
[/quote]
yeah mopar rig each page to be queried by the google bot and use a google search for adsense++[/quote]

It changes so often, would that even work?

Taharok:

Oh and, perhaps you could make it so you can sort the servers based on name, ip, port, date registered, uptime, etc.

It already sorts by uptime, and then resorts by date registered so that for each % the oldest is at the top? Would any other way be useful?

As far as 503 servers go, when it comes to that I will write a method for checking if they are online and post a different serverstatus page elsewhere with them on it, sound reasonable?

Read full topic
